amendment.description: Amendment sought to specify that the proposed moratorium on regulatory rulemaking not apply to six "common sense" regulatory actions: rulemaking actions regarding the personal use of campaign funds; immigrant asylum requests; rulemaking actions by HUD to establish housing assistance preferences for the elderly, eliminating drugs from Federal housing, and designating urban empowerment zones; compensating Persian Gulf War veterans; Department of Justice rulemaking regarding development of a computer database to identify persons convicted of sexually violent offenses against minors; and rulemaking action by the Department of the Interior to establish hunting seasons for migratory birds.
amendment.purpose: An amendment (printed as amendment No. 7 in the Congressional Record of February 22, 1995) to specify that the bill's proposed moratorium on regulatory rulemaking shall not apply to six "common sense" regulatory actions: 1.Rulemaking actions regarding the personal use of campaign funds; 2. immigrant asylum requests; 3. rulemaking actions by the department of HUD to establish housing assistance preferences for the elderly, eliminating drugs for federal housing, and designating urban empowerment zones; 4. compensating Persian Gulf War veterans; 5. Department of Justice rulemaking regarding development of a computer database to identify persons convicted of sexually violent offenses against minors; 6. rulemaking action by the Department of the Interior to establish hunting seasons for migratory birds.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Collins (IL) amendment (A007) Failed by recorded vote: 181 - 242 (Roll no. 164).
